member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.AutoFiller
member.summary: Represents a class to receive data from database or other datasource, fills them into the designed fields of the template pdf and at last generates new pdf file or stream. It has two template file input modes:input as a stream or a pdf file. It has four types of output modes:one merged stream, one merged file, many small streams, many small files. It can recieve literal data contained in a System.Data.DataTable.

member.summary: Imports data of DataTable type. Every column's name of the dataTable must be the same as one field name of the template pdf in case sensitive.
member.param: The dataTable which contains all the data from database or other data source.

member.summary: xmp:Advisory property. An unordered array specifying properties that were edited outside the authoring application. Each item should contain a single /// namespace and XPath separated by one ASCII space

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DefaultMetadataProperties.BaseURL
member.summary: xmp:BaseURL property. The base URL for relative URLs in the document content. If this document contains Internet links, and those links are relative, /// they are relative to this base URL. This property provides a standard way for embedded relative URLs to be interpreted by tools. /// Web authoring tools should set the value based on their notion of where URLs will be interpreted

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege
member.summary: Represents the privileges for accessing Pdf file. Refer to. There are 4 ways using this class: 1.Using predefined privilege directly. 2.Based on a predefined privilege and change some specifical permissions. 3.Based on a predefined privilege and change some specifical Adobe Professional permissions combination. 4.Mixes the way2 and way3.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary:
Compares two objects.
The object to compare with.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowPrint
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow print or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowDegradedPrinting
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow degraded printing or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowModifyContents
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow modify contents or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowCopy
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow copy or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow modify annotations or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowFillIn
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow fill in forms or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowScreenReaders
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow screen readers or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.AllowAssembly
member.summary: Sets the permission which allow assembly or not. true is allow and false is forbidden.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.PrintAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the print level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Printing Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Low Resolution (150 dpi). 2: High Resolution.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.ChangeAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the change level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's Changes Allowed settings. 0: None. 1: Inserting, Deleting and Rotating pages. 2: Filling in form fields and signing existing signature fields. 3: Commenting, filling in form fields, and signing existing signature fields. 4: Any except extracting pages.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege.CopyAllowLevel
member.summary: Sets the copy level of document's privilege. Just as the Adobe Professional's permission settings. 0: None. 1: Enable text access for screen reader devices for the visually impaired. 2: Enable copying of text, images and other content.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.#ctor
M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fills the field with a valid value according to a fully qualified field name. Before filling the fields, every field's names and its corresponding valid values must be known. Both the fields' name and values are case sensitive.
member.param: The field's name to be filled.
The field's value which must be a valid value for some fields.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills the radio box field with a valid index value according to a fully qualified field name. Before filling the fields, only field's name must be known. While the value can be specified by its index. Notice: Only be applied to Radio Box, Combo Box and List Box fields.
member.param: The field's name to be filled.
The selected box's index in the whole radio box group.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillField(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fills the check box field with a boolean value. Notice: Only be applied to Check Box.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); form.FillField("checkboxField", true);

member.param: The field's name to be filled.
A boolean flag: true means to check the box, while false to uncheck it..

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetButtonOptionCurrentValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the current value for radio button option fields.
member.returns: String value for the current radio group optino. See also

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine(form.GetButtonOptionCurrentValue("btnField"));

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetButtonOptionValues(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the radio button option fields and related values based on the field name. This method has meaning for radio button groups.
member.returns: Hash table of option values keyed by form item name

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetField(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the field's value according to its field name.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine("Field value = " + form.GetField("Field1"));

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetFullFieldName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the full field name according to its short field name.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine("Full field name is : " + form.GetFullFieldName("textField"));

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.GetFieldLimit(System.String)
member.summary: Get the limitation of text field.
member.returns: Return the limitation number of characters a text field can be filled. It not set, return 0.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); Console.WriteLine(form.GetFieldLimit("textfieldBox"));

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.Save
member.summary: Saves the value of the filled fields and close the opened Pdf document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FlattenAllFields
member.summary: Flattens all the fields.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); form.FlattenAllFields();

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FlattenField(System.String)
member.summary: Flattens a specified field with the fully qualified field name. Any other field will remain unchangable. If the fieldName is invalid, all the fields will remain unchangable.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); form.FlattenField("textField");

member.param: The name of the field to be flattened.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Form.FillBarcodeField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fill a barcode field according to its fully qualified field name.
member.returns: If filling succeed, return true; otherwise, false.

example.code: Form form = new Form("PdfForm.pdf"); form.FillBarcodeField("textField", "42207252");

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter
member.summary: Represents a class to convert data from one format to another format. It can convert the data in fdf/xml/pdf/xfdf to the OLEDB/OdbcDB. It also can convert the data in the OLEDB/OdbcDB to the data in fdf/xml/xfdf. It can convert the fdf to the xml with "hard-named" tag.

member.summary: Constructor for FormDataConverter class.

member.summary: Convert files of strems into table.
member.param: Array of source streams in specified format.
Format of data in streams. Valid values are: PDF, FDF, XFDF, XML.

member.summary: Imports data from table into database.
member.param: Type of database connection: OLEDB or ODBC.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ExportFromDataBase(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: Exports data from database into table.

member.summary: Convert data in table into streams.
member.param: Streams where data will be stored.
Type of stored data. Valid values are: XML, FDF, XFDF.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.ConverToStreams(System.IO.Stream[],Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DataType)
member.summary: This method is obsolete. Please use ConvertToStreams() instead.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.FormDataConverter.Table
member.summary: Gets or sets the middle data container, one DataTable. It must be defined before converting data from one format to another format. The Columns and TableName of the DataTable should be defined. The TableName is the name of the Table in the database. Every column's ColumnName is the qualified field name of the pdf. Every column's Caption is the column name of table in the database. If the field name is the same as the table column name, the Caption need not specified.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize
member.summary: Defines different key sizes which can be used to encrypt pdf documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x40
member.summary: 40 bit key. Such key size is used with RC4 algorithm and provides low level of security. Nevertheless old versions of pdf documents can be encrypted only with such keys (v. 1.3 and lower);

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x128
member.summary: 128 bit key. Both RC4 and AES algorithms can use such key size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize.x256
member.summary: 256 bit key. Such key size can be used only with AES and is recognized with the last Adobe Reader versions (starting from v.9).

member.summary: Creates line annotation.
member.param: The annotation rectangle defining the location of the annotation on the page.
The starting horizontal coordinate of the line.
The starting vertical coordinate of the line.
The ending horizontal coordinate of the line.
The ending vertical coordinate of the line.
The number of original page where the annotation will be created.
The border width in points. If this value is 0 no border is drawn. Default value is 1.
The border style specifying the width and dash pattern to be used in drawing the line. This value can be: "S" (Solid), "D" (Dashed), "B" (Beveled), "I" (Inset), "U" (Underline).
A dash array defining a pattern of dashes and gaps to be used in drawing a dashed border. If it is used, borderSyle must be accordingly set to "D".

An array of two values respectively specifying the beginning and ending style of the drawing line. The values can be: "Square", "Circle", "Diamond", "OpenArrow", "ClosedArrow", "None", "Butt", "ROpenArrow", "RClosedArrow", "Slash".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfExtractor.IsBidi
member.summary: Is true when text has hebriew or arabic symbols. This case must be specially considered because string functions change their behaviour and start process text from right to left (except numbers and other non text chars).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfExtractor.Resolution
member.summary: Set or gets resolution for extracted images. Default value is 150. Images which have greater resolution value are more clear. However increasing resolution value results in increasing time and memory needed to extract images. Usually to get clear image it's enough to set resolution to 150 or 300.

Stream where result file will be stored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.Concatenate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merges two Pdf documents into a new Pdf document with pages in alternate ways and fill the blank places with blank pages. e.g.: document1 has 5 pages: p1, p2, p3, p4, p5. document2 has 3 pages: p1', p2', p3'. Merging the two Pdf document will produce the result document with pages:p1, p1', p2, p2', p3, p3', p4, blankpage, p5, blankpage.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.Concatenate("src1.pdf", "src2.pdf", "blank.pdf", "dest.pdf");

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.Concatenate(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Merges two Pdf documents into a new Pdf document with pages in alternate ways and fill the blank places with blank pages. e.g.: document1 has 5 pages: p1, p2, p3, p4, p5. document2 has 3 pages: p1', p2', p3'. Merging the two Pdf document will produce the result document with pages:p1, p1', p2, p2', p3, p3', p4, blankpage, p5, blankpage.
member.param: The Pdf Stream with blank page

example.code: PdfFileEditor fileEditor = new PdfFileEditor(); fileEditor.Append("input.pdf", new string[] { "file1.pdf", "file2.pdf"}, 3, 5, "outfile.pdf");

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF files to outputFile. Each page of outputFile will contain multi pages, which are combination with pages in the input files of the same page number. The multi pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Output pdf file path and name.
Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically.
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

example.code: PdfFileEditor pfe = new PdfFileEditor(); pfe.MakeNUp(new string[] { "input1.pdf", "input2.pdf", "input3.pdf" }, "output.pdf", false);

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileEditor.MakeNUp(System.IO.Stream[],System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes N-Up document from the multi input PDF streams to outputStream. Each page of outputStream will contain multi pages, which are combination with pages in the input streams of the same page number. The multi-pages piled up horizontally if isSidewise is true and piled up vertically if isSidewise is false.
member.param: Output pdf stream. Piled up way, true for horizontally and flase for vertically
member.returns: boolean - True for success, or false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity
member.summary: Represents encrypting or decrypting a Pdf file with owner or user password, changing the security setting and password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initialize the object of PdfFileSecurity with input and output stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the object of PdfFileSecurity with input and output file.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the object of PdfFileSecurity.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.EncryptFile(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize)
member.summary: Encrypts Pdf file with userpassword and ownerpassword and sets the document's privileges to access. The user password and the owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the input owner password is null or empty.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass", "ownerpass", DocumentPrivilege.Print, KeySize.x256);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass", "ownerpass", DocumentPrivilege.Print, KeySize.x256)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.EncryptFile(System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Algorithm)
member.summary: Encrypts Pdf file with userpassword and ownerpassword and sets the document's privileges to access. The user password and the owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the input owner password is null or empty. There are 6 possible combinations of KeySize and Algorithm values. However (KeySize.x40, Algorithm.AES) and (KeySize.x256, Algorithm.RC4) are invalid and corresponding exception will be raised if kit encounters this combination.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.
Algorithm.AES to encrypt using AES algorithm or Algorithm.RC4 for RC4 encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.EncryptFile("userpass","ownerpass",DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.DecryptFile(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts an encrypted Pdf document by owner password. If the document hasn't owner password, it is allow to use user password.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0404.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.DecryptFile("ownerpass");
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0404.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.DecryptFile("ownerpass")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.SetPrivilege(Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege)

[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(DocumentPrivilege.Print);

Dim outFile As String = "..1\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.SetPrivilege(DocumentPrivilege.Print)

[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\example1.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0405.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the user password and owner password by owner password, keeps the original security settings. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0406.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner");
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0406.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize)
member.summary: Changes the user password and password by owner password, allows to reset Pdf documnent security. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSecurity.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.DocumentPrivilege,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.KeySize,Aspose.Pdf.Facades.Algorithm)
member.summary: Changes the user password and password by owner password, allows to reset Pdf documnent security. The new user password and the new owner password can be null or empty. The owner password will be replaced with a random string if the new owner password is null or empty. There are 6 possible combinations of KeySize and Algorithm values. However (KeySize.x40, Algorithm.AES) and (KeySize.x256, Algorithm.RC4) are invalid and corresponding exception will be raised if kit encounters this combination.
member.param: KeySize.x40 for 40 bits encryption, KeySize.x128 for 128 bits encryption and KeySize.x256 for 256 bits encryption.
Algorithm.AES to encrypt using AES algorithm or Algorithm.RC4 for RC4 encryption.

example.code:
[C#] string inFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. string outFile = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf"; //The TestPath may be re-assigned. PdfFileSecurity fileSecurity = new PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile); fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES);
[Visual Basic] Dim inFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0401.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim outFile As String = "..\\AsposePdfKitExample\\Kit0407.pdf" 'The TestPath may be re-assigned.' Dim fileSecurity As PdfFileSecurity = New PdfFileSecurity(inFile,outFile) fileSecurity.ChangePassword("owner","newuser","newowner", DocumentPrivilege.Print,KeySize.x256,Algorithm.AES)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Forms.Signature)

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature.
member.param: The page on which signature is made.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1, PKCS7 and PKCS7Detached. Such data as signature reason, contact and location must be already present in this object (see corresponding properties).

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature which is placed in already presented signature field. Before signing signature field must be empty, i.e. field must not contain signature dictionary. Thus pdf document already has signature field, you should not supply the place to stamp the signature, corresponding page and rectangle are taken from signature field which is found by signature name (see SigName parameter).
member.param: The name of the signature field.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1, PKCS7 and PKCS7Detached.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfFileSignature.Sign(System.String,Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Forms.Signature)
member.summary: Sign the document with the given type signature which is placed in already presented signature field. Before signing signature field must be empty, i.e. field must not contain signature dictionary. Thus pdf document already has signature field, you should not supply the place to stamp the signature, corresponding page and rectangle are taken from signature field which is found by signature name (see SigName parameter). Such data as signature reason, contact and location must be provided by corresponding properties of the Signature object sig.
member.param: The name of the signature field.
The type of the signature, could be PKCS1 (Pkcs1Signature object), PKCS7 and PKCS7 detached (Pkcs7Signature object)

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer
member.summary: Represents a class to view or print a pdf.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed..

example.code:
[C#] PdfViewer viewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true; //print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true; //print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))); viewer.ClosePdfFile();
[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintLargePdf(new MemoryStream(File.ReadAllBytes(@"d:\test.pdf"))) viewer.ClosePdfFile()

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file with specified printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream with specified printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed..

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.String,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf file with specified page settings and printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintLargePdf(System.IO.Stream,System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Opens and prints a large Pdf stream with specified page settings and printer settings. If your Pdf file has hundreds of pages or more or its size is more than 3 MB, this method is recommended to get better performance.
member.remarks: This method has integrated the opening and the printing of the file and you need not calling the OpenPdfFile() explicitly.
member.param: The pdf stream to be opened and printed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup
member.summary: Prints the Pdf document with a setup dialog. Choose a printer using the dialog.

example.code:
[C#] PdfViewer viewer = new PdfViewer(); viewer.OpenPdfFile(@"d:\test.pdf"); viewer.AutoResize = true; //print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true; //print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup(); viewer.ClosePdfFile();
[VisualBasic] Dim viewer As PdfViewer = new PdfViewer() viewer.OpenPdfFile(@"d:\test.pdf") viewer.AutoResize = true 'print the file with adjusted size viewer.AutoRotate = true 'print the file with adjusted rotation viewer.PrintPageDialog=false;//do not produce the page number dialog when printing viewer.PrintDocumentWithSetup() viewer.ClosePdfFile()

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintDocumentWithSettings(System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings,System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Prints the Pdf document with settings. If the document size is not complatible to page size, pdf.kit will extend it to fit page size.
member.param: The page setting of the printing document.
The printer setting of the printing document.

example.remarks: printerSettings object is used to print the document. pageSettings.PrinterSettings object is ignored.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Facades.PdfViewer.PrintDocumentWithSettings(System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings)
member.summary: Prints the Pdf document with printer settings. The output page size will fit the the document first page size.
member.param: The printer setting of the printing document.

member.summary: Sets or gets the rotation of stamp content according values. Note. This property is for set angles which are multiples of 90 degrees (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees). To set arbitrary angle use RotateAngle property. If angle set by ArbitraryAngle is not multiple of 90 then Rotate property returns Rotation.None.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags
member.summary: A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the annotation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Default
member.summary: Default value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams to display auxiliary pop-up information similar in function to online help systems.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful, for example, for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: If set, do not scale the annotations appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) remains fixed, regardless of the page magnification.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: If set, do not rotate the annotations appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle remains in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotations contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events. A typical use is to have an annotation that appears only when a mouse cursor is held over it.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.FitBExplicitDestination
member.summary: Represents explicit destination that displays the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.FitRExplicitDestination
member.summary: Represents explicit destination that displays the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and topentirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.XYZExplicitDestination
member.summary: Represents explicit destination that displays the page with the coordinates (left,top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.Exclude
member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission.

member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/Exclude flag shall be submitted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.ExportFormat
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted in HTML Form format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted using an HTTP GET request.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action shall be transmitted as part of the form data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.Xfdf
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted as XFDF.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file shall include the contents of all incremental updates.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF file shall include includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.SubmitPdf
member.summary: If set, the document shall be submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates shall be converted to the standard format.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: If set, it shall include only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.ExclFKey
member.summary: If set, the submitted FDF shall exclude the F entry.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.SubmitFormAction.EmbedForm
member.summary: If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF shall be a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: License number was added as embedded resource.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions
member.summary: This enum represents user's permissions for a pdf.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.PrintDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 2) Print the document. (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether is also set).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ModifyContent
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by , , and 11.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ExtractContent
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 2) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes). (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by .

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ModifyTextAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.FillForm
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.ExtractContentWithDisabilities
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Permissions.PrintingQuality
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and bit 3 is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Text.TextFragment
member.summary: Represents fragment of Pdf text.
member.remarks:
In a few words, object contains list of objects.
In details: Text of pdf document in is represented by two basic objects: and
The differences between them is mostly context-dependent.
Let's consider following scenario. User searches text "hello world" to operate with it, change it's properties, look etc.
Document doc = new Document(docFile); TextFragmentAbsorber absorber = new TextFragmentAbsorber("hello world"); doc.Pages[1].Accept(absorber);
Phisycally pdf text's representation is very complex. The text "hello world" may consist of several phisycally independent text segments.
The Aspose.Pdf text model basically establishes that object provides single logic operation set over physical objects set that represent user's query.
In text search scenario, is logical "hello world" text representation, and object collection represents all physical segments that construct "hello world" text object.
So, is close to logical text representation. And is close to physical text representation.
Obviously each object may have it's own font, coloring, positioning properties.
provides simple way to change text with it's properties: set font, set font size, set font color etc. Meanwhile objects are accessible and users are able to operate with objects independently.
Note that changing TextFragment properties may change inner collection because TextFragment is an aggregate object and it may rearrange internal segments or merge them into single segment. If your requirement is to leave the collection unchanged, please change inner segments individually.

member.summary: Represents an absorber object of text fragments. Performs text search and provides access to search results via collection.
member.remarks: The object is basically used in text search scenario. When the search is completed the occurrences are represented with objects that the collection contains. The object provides access to the search occurrence text, text properties, and allows to edit text and change the text state (font, font size, color etc).

member.remarks:
In a few words, objects are children of object.
In details:
Text of pdf document in is represented by two basic objects: and
The differences between them is mostly context-dependent.
Let's consider following scenario. User searches text "hello world" to operate with it, change it's properties, look etc.
Document doc = new Document(docFile); TextFragmentAbsorber absorber = new TextFragmentAbsorber("hello world"); doc.Pages[1].Accept(absorber);
Phisycally pdf text's representation is very complex. The text "hello world" may consist of several phisycally independent text segments.
The Aspose.Pdf text model basically establishes that object provides single logic operation set over physical objects set that represent user's query.
In text search scenario, is logical "hello world" text representation, and object collection represents all physical segments that construct "hello world" text object.
So, is close to logical text representation. And is close to physical text representation.
Obviously each object may have it's own font, coloring, positioning properties.
provides simple way to change text with it's properties: set font, set font size, set font color etc. Meanwhile objects are accessible and users are able to operate with objects independently.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType
member.summary: Enumerates the types of explicit destinations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page with the coordinates (left,top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.Fit
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitR
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and topentirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitB
member.summary: Display the page with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.InteractiveFeatures.ExplicitDestinationType.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.summary: This enum represents known password types used for password protected pdf documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PasswordType.None
member.summary: Pdf document is not password protected.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PasswordType.User
member.summary: Pdf document was opened using document open password (restricted access).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PasswordType.Owner
member.summary: Pdf document was opened using change permissions password (full access).

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PasswordType.Inaccessible
member.summary: Pdf document is password protected but both user and owner passwords are not empty and none of the passwords was defined or supplied password was incorrect. So it impossible to deduce the type of the password.

member.summary: Justify alignment. Text will be aligned on both left and right margins.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.AlignmentType.FullJustify
member.summary: Similar to 'Justify' alignment, except that the very last line will only be left-aligned in 'Justify' mode, while in 'FullJustify' mode all lines will be left- and right-aligned.

member.summary: Represents a paragraph object.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets object that indicates the margin info of the paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the ID of the paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsFirstParagraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph is the first paragraph of a page. If this property is set to true,Aspose.Pdf.Generator will start a new page for this paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsFirstParagraphInColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph be the first paragraph of a column.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsKeptTogether
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether all lines in the paragraph are to remain on the same page. Default is false. This property only affects paragraphs in section (but not in table).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsKeptWithNext
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether current paragraph remains in the same page along with next paragraph. Default is false. This property only affects paragraphs in section (but ont in table) except FloatingBox, which position is set by manual.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph is disabled. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, this paragraph will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsInList
member.summary: Get or set a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph is used as a list item. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, this paragraph will appear in the list when the list is constructed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.Bookmarked
member.summary: Get or set a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph is used as a bookmark item.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.IsOnOddPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph be shown in odd page only. This property used for duplex Printing. If you want to print a paragraph in a new odd page in duplex Printing,you can set "IsFirstParagraph = true" and "IsOnOddPage = true".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the left position of the paragraph. The unit is point.
member.remarks: The property is used for custom positioning. You need not use this property if you want the paragraph be auto aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the top position of the paragraph. The unit is point.
member.remarks: The property is used for custom positioning. You need not use this property if you want the paragraph be auto aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.PositioningType
member.summary: The positioning type for custom positioning. Default value is Auto (don not use custom positioning).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph.ReferenceParagraphID
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the reference paragraph when using paragraph relative customer positioning.
member.remarks: The reference paragraph must be ahead of the current paragraph in the document object model.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the ID of the paragraph that the bookmark item links to. If this property is set, the and properties are not needed. If the link paragraph is or and the is not set, the content of the or will be used as the title of the bookmark item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a int number that indicates the page number of the bookmark link. If the is set, this property is not needed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Bookmark.YPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a float number that indicates the Y coordination of the bookmark link. The origin of the coordination is the lower-left corner of the page. If the is set, this property is not needed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.BorderInfo
member.summary: Encapsulates the border info for the , and .

example.code:
[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) [XML]
ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1 cell2

[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Cells
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

example.code:
[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) [XML]
ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1 cell2

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ColumnInfo.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a int value that indicates the number of columns in each page in the section.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ColumnInfo.ColumnWidths
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the width of columns in each page in the section. The value of each column should be separated by blank.The default unit is point, but cm, inch and percentage of available width are also supported.For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch",or "60% 40%". The max column number is 16.
member.remarks: If this property is not set, column width will be calculated automatically according to and .

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ColumnInfo.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the spacing between columns in each page in the section. The value of each spacing should be separated by blank. The default unit is point, but cm and inch are also supported.For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch".
member.remarks: If this property is not set, default value 1.25cm will be used for each spacing.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.FormField.TextFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the font name of the text field. The core fonts (Courier,Courier-Bold,Courier-BoldOblique,Courier-Oblique,Helvetica,Helvetica-Bold, Helvetica-BoldOblique, Helvetica-Oblique,Symbol,Times-Bold,Times-BoldItalic,Times-Italic, Times-Roman and ZapfDingbats) and Truetype fonts are supported. When using Truetype font, you should use the font family name. If you want the font be bold or italic, set the font name like "Arial,Bold","Arial,Italic" or "Arial,BoldItalic".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.IsSpaced
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the spaces at the begin of the text and returns in the text be shown. For the following XML:
<Text> <Segment>The first line, The second line.</Segment> </Text>
If IsSpaced is false, the result will be:
The first line,The second line.
If IsSpaced is true, the result will be:
The first line, The second line.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether SVG areas supported.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the Widow/Orphan control is enabled. Default is true. If it is true, Widow/Orphan control is enabled and Widows/orphans themselves are eliminated (disabled).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.IsAlignedByWord
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the text is aligned by word. This property should be set to false when using Asian language such as chinese.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.TextWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the width paragraph.The unit is point. //zyqw:
member.remarks: The property is used for custom positioning. You need not use this property if you want the paragraph be auto aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.RotatingAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the number of degrees by which the text should be rotated anticlockwise when displayed or printed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.WrapLines
member.summary: Gets or sets a maximum count of wrapped lines in text. All lines over this value will be cutted. Default value is 0 (text is uncutted).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Text.IsFitToPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph need to be placed on single page. Default value is false.The attribute is only valid when the paragraph is the first paragraph on a page;

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph need to be repeated on next page. Default value is false.The attribute is only valid when the paragraph itself and the object its ReferenceParagraphID referred to both are included in RepeatingRows.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the HTML 5 tags in text is supported. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.Label
member.summary:
Gets or sets an string value that indicates the user-defined heading label. If you want to use the charactor in the charactor set, please use #$UNICODE() . Set this property to 'bullet1','bullet2'...'bullet7' to use system-defined bullet. Example 1: Label = #$UNICODE(9633); //It will print
Example 2: Label = 9633 ; //It will print 9633
Example 3: Label = bullet1; //It will print

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.LabelWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the width of the label of the heading. Default value is 30 points.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.BulletOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the offset of the bullet.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the color of the bullet/label.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the alignment type of Bullet/Label.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the alignment type of Bullet/Label. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. You should use LabelAlignment to set the alignment type of Bullet/Label. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.6.2.0 in February 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.BulletColor
member.summary: . Gets or sets a value that indicates the color of the bullet/label. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. You should use LabelColor to set the color of bullet/label.. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.6.2.0 in February 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string value that indicates the font name of label.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the number of the heading is in an automatical sequence.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.HeadingType
member.summary: Gets or sets the of this heading.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.UserLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the caption label. For example, UserLabel="1.3.5". Set this property to 'bullet1','bullet2'...'bullet7' to use system-defined bullet. To use user defined lebel, Set the to "Symbol" and "ZapfDingbats" and set this property to the char value of the bullt symbol. For example,Userlabel="44" and BulletFontName="ZapfDingbats". NOTE: This property is now obsolete. You should use Label to set the user label. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.8.0.0 in February 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.ImageLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the an Image that is used as label.If ImageLabel is not null, the ImageLabel substitutes for number heading. The size of the ImageLabel will be adjusted following the Segment.TextInfo.FontSize.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.LabelPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the heading pattern in the "ch(s)%ch(s)" form, ch(s) can be none ,an ASCII or a combination of ASCIIs, % stands for the heading number. For example, "(%)" means "(1.1)" if here % equals 1.1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.BulletFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the font name for bullet. "Symbol" and "ZapfDingbats" are supported. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. You should use LabelFontName to set the font name for bullet. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.6.2.0 in February 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.IsBulletUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the bullet/Label uses a unicode character. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. You should use isLabelUnicode to set whether the bullet/Label uses a unicode character. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.6.2.0 in February 2008. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.IsLabelUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the bullet/Label uses a unicode character.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.BulletTTFFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the truetype font file name for the bullet. This property is only needed when using truetype font with unicode. If your truetype font has been installed in your system, you can use truetype font with unicode without this property. But using this property will greatly improve the performance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.StartNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a int number that indicates the start number of this heading when using auto numbering.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Heading.IsPrefixed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if the prefix of the number is shown when using auto sequence. For example,for a label "1.2.5", if this property is set to false, the label will be "5".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.IsNeedRepeating
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph need to be repeated on next page. Default value is false.The attribute is only valid when the paragraph itself and the object its ReferenceParagraphID referred to both are included in RepeatingRows.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.ImageNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection that indicates all notes in the image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.ImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the image width. This property is not used to control the image width but used to spefity the image width when there is no width info in image,e.g., CCITT fax image or image on the web. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Web image can be supported by setting the URL in Image.ImageInfo.File.You need not set this property any more. For CCITT image, please use ImageInfo.CcittImageWidth instead. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.ImageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the image height.This property is not used to control the image height but used to spefity the image width when there is no height info in image,e.g., CCITT fax image or image on the web. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Web image can be supported by setting the URL in Image.ImageInfo.File.You need not set this property any more. For CCITT image, please use ImageInfo.CcittImageHeight instead. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the scale rate of the image when placed into pdf file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.IsImageFitToRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the image fit to the size of cell which has the only image paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the opacity of the image. The default value is 1.0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.Hyperlink
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the hyper link info of the image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.ZIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets a int value that indicates the Z-order of the image. A image with larger ZIndex will be placed over the image with smaller ZIndex. ZIndex can be negative. Image with negative ZIndex will be placed behind the text in the page.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.RotatingAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value between -90 and 90 that indicates the number of degrees by which the image should be rotated anticlockwise when displayed or printed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Image.AutoNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a automated seqence number for Image objects. The default first value is 1. If set to be n,the value of the next image will be (n+1).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsBlack1
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether black is considered as 1 in an image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.ComponentNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets an int value that indicates the color component number of the image. This property is need only when using web image. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Web image can be supported by setting the URL in Image.ImageInfo.File.You need not set this property any more. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.BitsPerComponent
member.summary: Gets or sets an int value that indicates the color bits per component of the image. This property is need only when using web image. NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.CcittSubFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the . Used for CCITT image type only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.TiffFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets an int value that indicates the valid frame of the TIFF image. The default value is 0. Used for TIFF image only. If this property is set to -1, all frames of the tiff images will be added into the PDF document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.FixWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the fixed width of the image. If this property is set, the image will be scaled to the fixed width.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsFixImgWidthSettedInXML
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates the fixed width of the image is setted in xml file

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.FixHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the fixed height of the image. If this property is set, the image will be scaled to the fixed height.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsFixImgHeightSettedInXML
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates the fixed height of the image is Setted in xml file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsBlackWhite
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the image is forced to be black-and-white. If TIFF image of CCITT subformat is used, this property must be set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.CcittImageWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the CCITT image width. CCITT image does not contain size information so the width and height must be set by user.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.CcittImageHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the CCITT image height. CCITT image does not contain size information so the width and height must be set by user.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsAllFramesInNewPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if all frames in TIFF images be rendered in new page.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.IsStencilMask
member.summary: Indicates whether this image is stencil mask.

member.summary: Color that is used as background for stencil mask image.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageInfo.PatternColor
member.summary: Color that is used for painting of image pattern

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageOpenType

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.ImageOpenType.Url
member.summary: Opens the image from a url directly. Only JPEG and CCITT image are supported. You can also use URL as file name in File open type which supports all image type.

For example,"10cm" or "5inch". NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Please use Margin property instead. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.3.1.0 in January 2007. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Section.AddParagraph(Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Paragraph)
member.summary: Add a paragraph into the section. This method is used in direct-to-file mode.That means all paragraphs will be rendered into pdf file without being saved in the document object model. Less memory will be consumed in this mode,but you can't access the paragraphs that be added into the document any more, so some of the advanced features such as combination of XML and API,hyperlink to specified paragraph,total page number in footer,etc.,is not available.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.Section.IsSpaced
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the spaces at the begin of the text and returns in the text be shown. For the following XML:
<Text> <Segment>The first line, The second line.</Segment> </Text>
If IsSpaced is false, the result will be:
The first line,The second line.
If IsSpaced is true, the result will be:
The first line, The second line.

member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the inner margin. The unit is point. In case of mirror margins we can use Inner and Outer instead of Left and Right In XML,the default unit is point,but cm and inch are also supported. For example,"10cm" or "5inch".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Generator.MarginInfo.Outer
